doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Kadirawel Narayan Vs. J. M. C. Priyadharshani & 2 Others before Hon. K. M. S. DISSANAYAKE, J
latest_doc_d.parties: Kadirawel Narayan Vs. J. M. C. Priyadharshani & 2 Others
latest_doc_d.judgement_by: Hon. K. M. S. DISSANAYAKE, J
latest_doc_d.keywords: Appeal from an order of a Provincial High Court dismissing an application in revision before it for non-appearance of the Petitioner and his Attorney-at-Law on a day assigned for his appearance in Court-Will an appeal lie directly to the Court of Appeal for such Order without first purging his default of appearance before the court of first instance thereat?-Can a record of proceedings be contradicted or varied directly, before the Court of Appeal without first instituting an inquiry before the relevant court of first instance.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Article 138 of Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.
